channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Google and Meta employees are apparently getting jealous of their wealthy Nvidia peers
item.description: "Bought a $100k family car in all cash and didn't have to think about it."

item.title: Weekly mortgage demand stalls, even though rates drop to lowest since April 2023
item.description: Mortgage rates fell last week for the fourth straight week, but neither current homeowners nor homebuyers seemed particularly impressed.

item.title: The upside analysts still see in Nvidia's highflying stock — live coverage
U.S. Olympian swimmer earns ‘just enough’ to cover her rent—she’s turned to social media for more cash
item.description: Silver medalist Daniella Ramirez says synchronized swimming doesn’t pay the bills.

item.title: Foot Locker posts comparable sales growth for the first time in six quarters
item.description: Foot Locker has spent two years transforming its business, and it's now seeing sales and margins expand, indicating its efforts are finally starting t...

item.title: Why a $24.1 million Babe Ruth jersey may seem like a bargain in the years ahead
The U.K.’s quantum advantage is about to pay off—but a government spending review risks squandering it
item.description: New NVIDIAs and Microsofts of quantum will be born, and today, there is a large chance that one or more of these will come from the U.K.

item.title: Goldman issues warning on how quickly market confidence has recovered from an August stocks slump
item.description: The speedy return of market confidence following a global sell-off in risky assets should be seen as a cause for concern, according to Goldman Sachs.

item.title: Nvidia’s stock momentum depends on answers to these 5 questions from earnings
Klarna has 1,800 employees it hopes AI will render obsolete
item.description: Klarna CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski wants to trim his staff to 2,000, from a peak of 5,000, with the help of AI.

item.title: Wednesday's analyst calls: Chipmaker to surge nearly 40%, Thermo Fisher a buy
item.description: A chipmaker and a lab equipment maker are among the stocks being talked about by analysts on Wednesday.

item.title: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway on cusp of joining $1 trillion club
Lego announces historic half-year as it launches 300 sets and 41 stores, cementing its lead in the toy industry
item.description: Lego’s results mark its strongest first-half ever and underscore the company’s clout amid a toy industry downturn hurting its rivals.

item.title: Lego revenue jumps 13% in first half of 2024, boosted by Lego Fortnite and diverse brick sets
item.description: Lego said revenue during the first six months of the year jumped 13%, reaching 31 billion Danish krone, or about $4.65 billion.

item.title: Dow notches fresh record close as U.S. stocks edge upward
